definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Fundraising isn’t just about who raised or donated the most money.
sentences.chinese: 公益活動不純粹是爲了比誰籌集或捐出了最多的款額。

sentences.english: It isn't certain that large cloud provide will offer idle cycles pro-bono to grid projects.
sentences.chinese: 不確定大雲提供將提供空閒週期電網項目的公益活動。

sentences.english: Yesterday, our class had a public benefit activity.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，我們班進行了一場公益活動。

sentences.english: Alighting Award belongs to the public welfare activities, no need to pay the entry fee.
sentences.chinese: “阿拉丁神燈獎”純屬公益活動，無需繳納報名費。

sentences.english: This campaign is praised as the biggest commonweal campaign in the Internet history in China.
sentences.chinese: 這次活動被譽爲中國互連網史上最大的一次公益活動。

sentences.english: Contact the charity before you start the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 在你進行公益活動之前請先與慈善組織聯繫。

sentences.english: I wish I could help much more other people in commonweal activities.
sentences.chinese: 我還希望在公益活動中幫助更多的人。

sentences.english: The public-spirited activity is one of important paths that business enterprise undertake righteous duty in Harmonious society.
sentences.chinese: 和諧社會公益活動是企業承擔道義責任主要途徑之一。

definition: to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
to originate/to initiate/to launch (an attack, an initiative etc)/to start/to propose sth (for the first time)
to spare no pains or effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
